modName: A Helpful Guide To Increase Skyrim's Performance and Stability - FPS and Optimization
summary: Squeezes out the ABSOLUTE MOST FPS and heavily increase the stability for Skyrim LE.
descriptionHtml:
[left][/left][b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Description[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]This guide will help you squeeze out the maximum performance on Skyrim LE so you can enjoy a more stable, crash-free game. You might be thinking why the screenshots have almost to no difference in frames. These images are just the BEFORE & AFTER of the console commands, all the other tweaks are applied. I just needed some screenshots for the guide :)

Also, this guide does not go fully in-depth. I understand this as my aim was to cover some parts that some guides do not cover.

Also also also, download the .7z file included in the downloads. It's basically an extension of this guide and is almost always updated for the maximum amount of performance. Each INI is up to date and never seen before.[/size]

[size=3][u][color=#00ff00]My PC Specs:[/color][/u]

[b][color=#ff0000]CPU[/color] [/b]- AMD-A4 [b][i][color=#ff7700]APU [/color][/i][/b](2.7GHz) [I don't even have a dedicated CPU and GPU]
[color=#ff0000][b]RAM [/b][/color]- 4GB DDR3
[b][color=#ff0000]GPU[/color] [/b]- Radeon HD 6450 (1GB)
[b][color=#ff0000]MONITOR[/color] [/b]- Samsung SyncMaster 2233 60hz (Increased refresh rate to 77)[color=#00ff00] (1680x1050)[/color]
[b][color=#ff0000]STORAGE[/color] [/b]- 1TB, HDD - 7200RPM
[b][color=#ff0000]OS[/color] [/b]- Windows 10 Home 64-bit

I have looked at countless tutorials on how to improve my frames. As you can see my specs are not the greatest, in fact, they are very poopy (I will be looking to upgrade my PC soon once I get my first job and earn enough money to buy one :D), but I still run Skyrim LE pretty stable with 200+ mods. Let's start with the guide.
[/size]
[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Images[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Before we start, take a look at the [b][i][color=#ff0000]BEFORE [/color][/i][/b]and [b][i][color=#00ff00]AFTER [/color][/i][/b]images. Again, these images are just before and after console commands, all other tweaks were applied already.[/size]

[size=3][i][u][color=#ff00ff]Skyrim Setting:[/color][/u][/i]

[list]
[*][size=3]1280x800[/size]
[*][size=3]Used LOW PRESET with HIGH TEXTURE SETTING[/size]
[*][size=3]200+ Mods installed[/size]
[/list][/size][size=3]
[b][i]FPS Indoors[/i][/b] - [color=#00ff00]90-120[/color] FPS+
[b][i]FPS Outdoors[/i] [/b]- [color=#ffff00]40-75[/color] FPS+

[/size][i]Rarely any freezing or stuttering, gameplay is very smooth.[/i]

[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Computer[/size][/color]
[/b]
[size=3]The first thing we will do is boost performance for your computer. This trick will help you achieve higher FPS in other games, not just Skyrim. The video I created is pretty long but I added a time stamp in the description so you can select which part you wish to go to. This video DOES NOT go very in-depth, the only reason it is long is because there are a lot of tweaks covered/mentioned. I recommend watching all of it fully because you may miss an important step or two and is very critical for boosting performance.

[b][i]P.S Don't mind my voice and my voice cracks, I was younger when I created this video. I planned to update it so it is more consistent, but I do not know yet.[/i][/b]

[youtube]h5qsuRz8rOc[/youtube][/size]

[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Software[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]The software you should use is mentioned in the video but there are some that I failed to mention.

[url=https://github.com/madbomb122/BlackViperScript]BlackViper Service Script[/url] - A straightforward application that disables and enables which services are needed and redundant automatically so you do not have to.

[/size][size=3][url=https://vvvv.org/contribution/windows-system-timer-tool]Windows System Timer Tool[/url] - I'm not fully aware of what this does but it helps my FPS. Many users also state that this tool helped them, therefore, it should be trustable. More info is given on the actual website. Timer setting should be set to [b][color=#ff0000]0.5[/color][/b]

[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCl_O9EWFYGVJI2Q7EvUMr9w/videos]PC Tweaks - YouTube Channel[/url] - Watch his videos, they are extremely well done, to the point and have helped me a lot in PC tweaking

[/size][i]...more software is included in the ZIP file located in the DOWNLOADS sectio[/i]n of this mod.

[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Cleaning Mods with TES5Edit[/size][/color]
[/b]
[size=3]Here are two videos to help you clean your mods. Cleaning mods is very simple and does not take too long. Cleaning procedure starts at [b]2:28[/b]. The second video is the same except it does not go into full detail.[/size]

[youtube]fw3g_N1jcZQ[/youtube]

[youtube]HpGKrmASG5k[/youtube]

[size=3]In the future, LOOT can tell you whatever mod needs cleaning. [/size][color=#ff0000][size=3][b]DO NOT MANUALLY CHECK FOR ERRORS IN TES5EDIT UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING, THIS COULD BREAK THE PLUGIN ITSELF. LOOT WILL TELL YOU WHICH MODS REQUIRE CLEANING![/b][/size][/color]

[color=#00ffff][size=3][i][url=https://www.reddit.com/r/skyrimmods/comments/8joq57/tes5edit_disable_popup_warning/]How to remove the WARNING in xEdit[/url]﻿[/i][/size][/color]

[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Mods[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Please remove all useless non-performance-increasing mods or mods you think you may not need at all as it just eats performance in your save file. Do not attempt to mod Skyrim too much if you know your PC cannot handle it (try to keep a maximum of 100 mods for Skyrim if you are on a very low-end rig). Here are some mods that can increase performance and help with stability as well as mods that are created by me to help you achieve the most FPS...

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68245?]Remove Unessasary NPCs[/url]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/76747/?]Bug fixes[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72725/?]Crash fixes[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214/?]Unofficial Skyrim Legendary Edition Patch
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85443/]Load Game CTD Fix[/url]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/78464/?]PerformanceHitRelief_REMASTERED[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79323/?]FPS Performance Optimization Compilation - FPOC
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/92777]Corrupted NIFs Patches - CNP[/url][/size]
[size=3]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14504/?]Vanilla Reduced Textures (USE x256 EDITION)[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60/?]Enhanced Blood Textures by dDefinder (USE NO SCREEN BLOOA IN THE OPTIONAL SECTION)[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35500/?]No More Blue Rock[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9670/?]Absorb tint effect removal[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58666/?]ONE MOUNTAIN - To Rule Them All[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79995/?]Whiterun texture memory usage reduction[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52462/?]Kill The Orchestra[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55240/?]Remove Underwater Grass and other stuff too - A Performance Mod[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64611/?]Insignificant Object Remover[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58212/?]Remove Exterior Fog[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32505/?]Skyrim Project Optimization[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43921/?]Bethesda Performance Textures - Animals and Creatures[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34981/?]No More Glowing Edges Mod[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29253/?]Remove Interior Fog V2[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/736/?]Interior and Dungeon Fog Remover[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73181/?]Remove Distracting Things
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/42360/?]Bethesda Performance Textures - Armor - Clothes - Weapons[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77791/?]No more Radial Blur - Performance optimization[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60603/?]Unofficial Enhanced Lights and FX ELFX SMIM ENB fps performance patch[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40706/?]OneTweak
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/86289]Skyrim Performance For All[/url]

My FPS Performance Optimization Compilation was [b][color=#ff0000]BANNED [/color][/b]due to it being against the rules (It was against the rules to upload compilations, regardless of permissions). So here are mods that I used in the compilation... [i](Bear in mind that some mods cause incompatibility with other mods. This means you should report any bugs or errors in the comment section so you can be helped out right away. I had the bugs, incompatibilities and errors inside the FOMOD, but that's all gone now)[/i].

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61732/?]Smoke and Dust Remover[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/736/?]Interior and Dungeon Fog Remover[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58156/?]Platoon Performance Mods[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75655/?]Darkerrim No Lighting[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37655/?]Skyrip[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74156/?]RemoveTrees-RemoverArvores[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61680/?]No More Blinding Fog[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56112/?]Remove the little rocks
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53692/?]Low Res Particles and Flora - LRPF[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56545/?]Subtle Cloak Spell Graphics[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75345/?]Beauty Of Fps Project[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6566/?]Shaders Begone - NoGlow[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/83368/?]Icefloes BeGone[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59894/?]No Snowflakes in Sovngarde[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/76684/?]Tree Mesh Remover by[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29985/?]Winterhold Delete Snow Patches[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79995?]Whiterun texture memory usage reduction[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/76772/]Encounter Script CTD Fix[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/78557/]Continue Game No Crash[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/92415?]No CobWebs in Player-Houses[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/92469?]Less of that Please
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49411?]No Scars[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9670/]Absorb Tint FX Removal[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58212/]Remove Exterior Fog
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77848]No Swirl Effect[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87652]Remove Magic Books[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87674]Remove Insignificant Items[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87676?]Remove Unnecessary Bones[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/86289?]Skyrim Performance For All[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/4385]Argonian Tale Remover[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/4390]Khajit Tale Remover[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/78174?]Remove Torch Glow[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61114?]Whiterun Performance Overhaul[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10789/?]Colorful Lights No Shadow[/url]﻿
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54964/]Colorful Lights No Shadow - DLCs[/url]

Obviously, you don't want to install every single mod on here. Just install the ones you need/want.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/78909/?]Switftshader DLL[/url][/size][size=3]
Sometimes, mods will make other mods redundant. Check for [img]https://i.imgur.com/orHWbpj.png[/img]﻿ to see if the mod is redundant.

[color=#ff00ff][b]Mods that can possibly eat up performance are...[/b][/color]

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]2k-4k Graphical texture overhaul (Try to use 512 or 1024 textures).[/size]
[*][size=3]Grass and Tree overhaul (More flora, more memory, more lag)[/size]
[*][size=3]ELFX (Outdoor module takes a hit, use the indoor module only or better yet, use RLO as it is more performance friendly).[/size]
[*][size=3]NPC AI Overhauls (InconNPCs and Immersive Citizens take a little hit on my system but I cannot live without them)[/size]
[*][size=3]Enemy AI overhauls (RotC, Deadly Combat and Duel - Combat Realism do not take too much of a performance hit for me).[/size]
[*][size=3]Enemy spawn increasers.[/size]
[*][size=3]OBIS.[/size]
[*][size=3]ENB presets.[/size]
[*][size=3]Heavy scripting mods.[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.reddit.com/r/skyrimmods/wiki/dangerous_mods_masterlist]Dangerous Mods Masterlist[/url]﻿[/size]
[/list]
[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Mod Settings[/size]
[/color][/b]
[size=3]These mods usually come with a configuration (INI, etc). Configure them for optimal performance and less crashes.[/size]

[size=3][i][color=#ff00ff][b]Crash Fixes[/b][/color][/i] - UseOSAllocators=1, CustomMemoryBlock=1, MemoryInfoConsole=1. If you still experience crashing, try AlignHeapAllocate=1 but if not, then leave it 0 because it increases loading times as well as higher memory consumption. To find you CustomMemoryBlockTotalSizeMB=?, you will have to load your save then press ~ key. You should see a bunch of percentages. Decrease this value until the percentages are [b][color=#9900ff]85%-90%[/color][/b]

[b][i][color=#ff00ff]Safety Load[/color][/i][/b] - EnableOnlyLoading=false. Basically [b][color=#00ff00]DEFAULT[/color][/b]

[b][i][color=#ff00ff]Enhanced Camera Mod[/color][/i][/b] - bFirstPersonShadows=0. Disables [color=#ff0000][b]SHADOWS[/b][/color]

[/size][i]...more mod settings are included in the .7z file located in the DOWNLOADS section.
[/i]
[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Software[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]There are a ton of software to help with Skyrim's stability, here are some...

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5Edit by ElminsterAU[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12801/?]Optimizer Textures (Ordenador) by AdPipino[/url]
[url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT by LOOT[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/?]Mod Organizer by Tannin42[/url][url=http://ntcore.com/]
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52363/?]Save game script cleaner by Hadoram[/url]

[i][b][color=#ff00ff]TES5Edit[/color][/b][/i] - Look above on how to use it as there is a tutorial there
[i][b][color=#ff00ff]Optimizer Textures[/color][/b][/i] - Helps optimize Skyrim's textures, instructions on the main page and on this guide page (Files)
[i][b][color=#ff00ff]LOOT[/color][/b][/i] - A very simple software, click the sort button and hit apply then you are finished.
[i][b][color=#ff00ff]Mod Organizer[/color][/b][/i] - Use this TOOL to sort and manage your mods. Best one in my opinion.
[i][b][color=#ff00ff]Save Cleaner[/color][/b][/i] - Removes remaining scripts of uninstalled mods. Run often. Click on Clean formlists, Reset havok, FixScriptInstances, Delete all #, Clean other, Del. Broken Activities, Advanced>Remove scripts attached to nonexistent created forms. [b]DO NOT use[/b] Remove a scripts having invalid variables, it can remove essential game scripts as well[/size]

[size=3][url=https://www.youtube.com/user/GophersVids/]Gopher[/url] has some videos that help with MO setup. Since it comes in parts, it will not be shown on this guide[/size]

[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]ENB[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Download [/size][url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.html]Skyrim's ENB here[/url][size=3]. Even though we are not installing an ENB preset, Skyrim ENB comes with a bunch of options to help us with performance and maximum stability.[/size]

[size=3]Once you have downloaded the file, extract the CONTENTS (not the actual folder) of the folder named "WrapperVersion" to where TESV.exe is located. Replace the enblocal.ini with the file provided on this page.[/size]

[size=3]If you want to use an [/size][b]ENB[/b][size=3], simply change UsePatchSpeedhackWithoutGraphics=[/size][color=#00ff00]true [/color][size=3]to UsePatchSpeedhackWithoutGraphics=[/size][color=#ff0000]false

[/color][i][size=2]More options are included in the .7z file located in the DOWNLOADS section of this mod page.[/size][/i]

[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]SKSE[/size][/color][/b]

[b][url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url][/b][size=3] is required by a lot of mods including the famous one, SkyUI. We are going to tweak an INI to help boost the game's performance.[/size]

[size=2][i]An SKSE.ini is included in the [b]DOWNLOADS [/b]section of this mod.[/i][/size]

[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Console Commands[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Probably the most simple portion of this guide it the CONSOLE COMMANDS. To type a command in-game, press the ~ key on your keyboard (usually beside the number key, 1)

Some performance commands with their values...

[b]Setfog 0,999999999999999[/b] - Removes exterior fog. [url=http://i.imgur.com/yDS2VDq.jpg]On[/url] vs. [url=http://i.imgur.com/SOxjTRc.jpg]Off[/url]

[b]pcb[/b] - Free up used memory, often times increase fps after any given amount of time in game. Best used while in interior cells. However, since it purges cached cells, any cells you visited in the recent past will have to be reloaded completely when reentered.

[b]tg[/b] - Removes grass (INCOMPATIBLE WITH GRASS OVERHAUL MODS BECAUSE IT REMOVES GRASS)

[b]teofis[/b] - Toggle end-of-frame image space. Gets rid of that ugly black filter on Skyrim. Also improves FPS by a hefty amount. Incompatible with mods that edit/enhance bloom, DoF, etc. ALSO, vampire and khajit vision will [color=#ff0000][b]NOT[/b][/color] work with this [color=#00ff00]ENABLED.[/color]

[b]SetSceneIsComplex 1[/b] - Animation and sound details are reduced,  combat does not check movement restrictions (actors may sidestep into objects, off ledges, etc), actors which are not in the loaded area WILL NOT UPDATE while this flag is set meaning they will not go through load doors, excess dead bodies in the loaded area are cleaned up more frequently, avoidance is disabled.

[b]SetAllVisible 1[/b] - Actors do not perform LineOfSight checks.

[b]SetNoAvoidance 1[/b] - Actors do not perform avoid box movement.

[b]SetAllReachable 1[/b] - Actors do not use pathing.

[b]ClearInvalidRegistrations[/b] - Name says it all. Removes invalid registrations from deleted mods.[/size][size=3]
[/size]
[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Skyrim.INI [/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Both INIs were passed through a lot of INI configurators such as BethINI, Skyrim Configurator and many more. DO NOT TELL ME TO USE BETHINI OR ANY OF THOSE TYPES OF SOFTWARE.

This is the 1st part of Skyrim INI tweaking. I SUGGEST BACKING UP. We will be using ModOrganizer's INI tweaking. If you find that settings are not working for you, do not edit through the DOCUMENTS folder but instead use the ModOrganizer INI tweaking.[/size]

[color=#00ff00][size=3][b][i]SKYRIMPREFS.INI ARE INCLUDED IN DOWNLOAD FILE[/i][/b]
[/size][/color]
[size=3]This will...[/size]

[list]
[*][size=3][b][u]Disable Grass[/u][/b][/size]
[*][size=3]Remove the clouds on the fast travel map making it clear.[/size]
[*][size=3]Remove fog.[/size]
[*][size=3]Remove the Blur on-hit effect.[/size]
[*][size=3]Make water will look less detailed (hardly noticeable).[/size]
[*][size=3]Disable VSync.[/size]
[*][size=3]Changes your game language to ENGLISH.[/size]
[*][size=3]Make your camera faster when switching POVs.[/size]
[/list][size=3]
...and more.
[/size]
[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3][color=#ff0000]IF YOU ARE EXPERIENCING HEAVY LAG, PLEASE DOWNLOAD THE SHADOW REMOVER MOD. ALSO IF YOU SEE YOUR INI FILES ARE RESETTING, USE SKSE TO OPEN SKYRIM. DO NOT OPEN THE GAME USING THE SKYRIM LAUNCHER[/color]

2nd part of Skyrim INI tweaking. I SUGGEST BACKING UP. We will be using ModOrganizer's INI tweaking. If you find that settings are not working for you, do not edit through the DOCUMENTS folder but instead use the ModOrganizer INI tweaking.[/size]

[color=#00ff00][size=3][b][i]SKYRIMPREFS.INI ARE INCLUDED IN DOWNLOAD FILE[/i][/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]This will...[/size]

[list]
[*][size=3]Disable Depth-Of-Field[/size]
[*][size=3]Remove any signs of shadows (Massive FPS boost)[/size]
[*][size=3]Remove grass shaders[/size]
[*][size=3]Disable gamepad[/size]
[*][size=3]Disable mouse acceleration[/size]
[*][size=3]Reduce particles[/size]
[*][size=3]Stop the rendering of skinned trees. [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/images/2/21/FTreesMidLODSwitchDist%3D5000.jpg]Skinned Trees[/url] vs. [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/images/1/17/FTreesMidLODSwitchDist%3D0.jpg]Non-Skinned Trees[/url][/size]
[*][size=3]Remove some decals[/size]
[*][size=3]Disable HDR[/size]
[*][size=3]Make water look a bit worse (not affected when using WATER mods)[/size]
[/list][size=3]
...and more
[/size]
[b][color=#ffff00][size=5]Suggestions[/size]
[/color][/b]
[size=3]You made it at the end of the guide. Your performance should be skyrocketing right now. After reading this guide is there anything I should add on to it? Just leave it in the comments and I will consider it. Also if you have any questions, be sure to ask me, I love replying to questions and I am always looking to help everyone. Be sure to check for updates. The INI files are updated very frequently. Finally, don't forget to endorse if this mod helped you. [b][color=#00ff00]THANK YOU[/color][/b] :)


[/size]~123keelos
author: 123keelos

files.name: ACAHGTISP 2.4
files.changelogHtml:
- Added MANY, MANY more settings to Skyrim INIs
- Changes to enblocal.ini
- Critical changes to all the ReadMe file
...many more!
